data.text: To all things there is a time,
A time of birth, and a time to die;
A time to kill, and a time to heal;
A time to weep, and a time to laugh;
A time to throw stones, and a time to gather stones together;
A time to seek, and a time to lose;
A time to rend, and a time to sew;
A time to love, and a time to hate;
What advantage has he that works in those things wherein he labors?
I have seen all the trouble,
All the things which he has made are beautiful in his time:
I know that there is no good in them,
Also in the case of every man who shall eat and drink,
I know that whatsoever things God has done,
That which has been is now;
And moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment,
And I said in my heart,
I said in my heart,
Also to them is the event of the sons of man,
All go to one place;
And who has seen the spirit of the sons of man,
And I saw that there was no good,
